Created attachment 568156
test case

STR:

1. open the attached test case in tab A.
2. open www.mozilla.com in tab B.
3. make a selection in tab B.
4. paste the selection using middle click in tab A, in the textarea.

Expected result: the selected text is pasted without rich formatting.

Actual result: the rich format of the selection is maintained when you paste.

comments.raw_text:
I can confirm this behaviour in Thunderbird 31.1.1.

I have tried using Shift-MiddleClick (as with Ctrl-Shift-V which strips the formatting for pasting the clipboard).


Additionally, there should be a keyboard shortcut to paste the X primary selection (usually Shift-Insert, but that pastes the primary clipboard - just like Ctrl-V). (Related/expired: bug 228011)

Why? Is there a middle-click paste standard to consider?

External consistency: the format is also kept when middle click pasting in LibreOffice.

Probably “works as expected”, or should be an optional feature.
